warning-info.text: Flood Warning for Georgina River and Eyre Creek
by the Bureau of Meteorology, Brisbane.
The next warning is due to be issued by 11:00 am AEST on Sunday 20th March 2016.

text.p: Issue Number: 12
Minor to moderate flood levels are occurring along the Georgina River, and further downstream along Eyre Creek.
No further significant rainfall is forecast.
GEORGINA RIVER:

Minor flood levels continue to ease at Roxborough Downs, whilst moderate flood levels are nearing a peak at Glenormiston. River levels further downstream at Marion Downs are expected to fall below moderate during Saturday.
EYRE CREEK:
Moderate flood levels at Bedourie peaked during Friday and have commenced to slowly ease during Saturday morning. Minor flood levels remain steady downstream at Glengyle.
GEORGINA RIVER at:
MARION DOWNS: Ease below the moderate flood level (4.0 metres) during the weekend. Renewed rises expected during next week as floodwaters arrive from the upper Georgina River.
EYRE CREEK at:
BEDOURIE: Likely to remain above the moderate flood level (4.0 metres) during the weekend.
GLENGYLE: Further small river rises likely to exceed the moderate flood level (3.0 metres) late in the weekend or early next week.
Predictions will be refined once upstream peaks are observed.
Remember: If it's flooded, forget it.
For flood emergency assistance contact the SES on 132 500
For life threatening emergencies, call Triple Zero (000) immediately
Current emergency information is available at www.qldalert.com

forecast-period.text: For the latest weather forecasts see: www.bom.gov.au/qld/forecasts

NA no obs reported
Warnings and River Height Bulletins are available at www.bom.gov.au/qld/flood
Flood Warnings are also available on telephone 1300 659 219 at a low call cost of 27.5 cents, more from mobile, public and satellite phones.

hazard.text: MODERATE FLOOD WARNING FOR THE GEORGINA RIVER AND EYRE CREEK
